answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some links you might find useful.
These are the New York State Guidelines for the Administration of Reductions in Force in Local Government, which has a section dedicated to seniority policies.
http://www.co.st-lawrence.ny.us/data/files/Departments/HumanResources/Reductions%20in%20Force%20Manual.pdf 
Here is the seniority policy from Gratiot County, MI.
http://www.co.gratiot.mi.us/LinkClick.aspx?fileticket=EwBqzECQH1Y%3D&tabid=137
This is a sample seniority policy from the fire department of Las Cruces, NM.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14059/Las_Cruces_Seniority_RIF 
City of Hays discusses seniority issues throughout its personnel policy.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302343/City_of_Hays_Personnel_Manual 
City of Healdsburg, CA has a similar policy.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14819/Personnel_Rules_and_Regulations
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Dorothy Bast
text: We are drafting a seniority policy for civil service employees and would appreciate hearing from other city governments who have a policy in place.
title: Seniority policy for civil service employees
